intro: Euphrasia perpusilla, commonly known as the small-eyed toadflax, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically features small, yellow-orange flowers with two lips, characteristic of the Scrophulariaceae family. The plant has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Euphrasia perpusilla is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in moist, calcareous soils.
